definition: to practice fraud (idiom); by trickery
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
variant of 弄[long4]
old variant of 弄[nong4]
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
variant of 假[jia3]/to borrow
fake/false/artificial/to borrow/if/suppose
vacation
see 假掰[gei1 bai1]

sentences.english: He is suspected of employing trickery.
Cheat in your education, and your income suffers.
sentences.chinese: 在上学时弄虚作假，你的收入就会受害。

sentences.english: You need to passionately share what you believe in, but don't fake it.
sentences.chinese: 你需要热情地分享你所相信的，但不要弄虚作假。

sentences.english: One key hazard, says Lehman's Schulte, is fraud.
sentences.chinese: 雷曼兄弟的肖特说，一个关键的不利因素是弄虚作假。

definition: to abuse one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
to engage in fraud
covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
false/phony/pretense
to misreport/fraudulent report
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to counterfeit/to pass off a fake as genuine
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to cover up (a matter that should be reported to the authorities)
to conceal or deceive in a report/to falsify by over- or underreporting
to violate (rules)/irregular/illegal/corrupt
buying and selling of official positions
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
